summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is enhancing telemedicine by enabling personalized HIV prevention and care through tools like AI-powered risk prediction models, chatbots, and virtual counselors. These technologies are being integrated into clinics and telemedicine platforms in low- and middle-income countries, such as Nigeria and Kenya, to improve PrEP accessibility, streamline service delivery, and provide stigma-free, remote support. AI also aids in demand forecasting, optimizing resource allocation, and expanding healthcare access in resource-constrained settings.
